abstract: If Goldman Sachs is guilty of what the S.E.C. is charging — that the bank created and marketed securities that were deliberately designed to fail so that an important client could make money off that failure — it amounts to white-collar looting, The New York Time’s Paul Krugman wrote in his latest Op-Ed.

lead_paragraph: Last October, I saw a cartoon by Mike Peters in which a teacher asks a student to create a sentence that uses the verb “sacks,” as in looting and pillaging. The student replies, “Goldman Sachs.”
